intro: Stenogyne viridialba, commonly known as the greenleaf stenogyne, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a bright green color. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in mesic to wet forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
